For simplicity sake, let's put aside Bush's monumental struggle to correct every other Presidents inept policies. Here is your initial post:
 
 "John Kerry was given a specific warning by the FAA about the possibility of terrorism launched from Logan Airport in May of 2001. He did nothing, yet he has not been questioned by the "bi-partisan" 9/11 Commission."
 
 OK, if the FAA, (a federal agency), warned Kerry, (a State Senator), of an impending threat, wouldn't it be logical to assume they make the same information available to the President and agencies whose job it actually is to react to such information?? It would be irresponsible for the FAA to withhold any data that might put the American public in danger. Do you actually believe that if they warned Kerry he was the first one told? Is a Senator even responsible for monitoring terrorist activity?

 I will agree, after consideration of how memos are like slugs in getting to the eyes of the intended recipient, that the story is a bit off base. The date of a memo is often weeks before the memo actually is read by the addressee.
 
 A frantic phone call would be more appropriate in transmitting knowledge of a dire emergency. I believe the purpose of the memo was to point out weaknesses in the security at airports, not to warn of some known plan.
 
 However, it is no less ludicrous to blame Bush for allowing the attacks of 9-11. As has been stated many times, the plans were in the making for a long time. Osama had been attacking us and getting off scot-free for a long time.
 
 I don't blame Kerry for 9-11 any more than I blame Bush...and that is NOT AT ALL!
